sentences.en: Charles has never felt the need to compete with anyone.
sentences.cn: 查尔斯从未感到有与任何人竞争的必要。

sentences.en: Dubbed foreign language films will not be allowed to compete for best film.
sentences.cn: 外国译制片不得参加最佳影片的角逐。

sentences.en: Each year they compete in a prominent statewide bicycle race.
sentences.cn: 每年他们都要参加著名的全州自行车大赛。

sentences.en: He will be competing in the 100-metre race.
sentences.cn: 他将参加100米比赛。

sentences.en: How many runners will be competing in the marathon?
sentences.cn: 会有多少人参加这次马拉松比赛？

sentences.en: I had to compete against 19 other people for the job.
sentences.cn: 我得和另外19个人竞争这份工作。

sentences.en: It made it almost impossible for the smaller retailer to compete against the multiples.
sentences.cn: 这使得小零售商几乎不可能跟连锁店竞争。

sentences.en: Lewis will compete in both sprints in Stuttgart.
sentences.cn: 刘易斯将参加在斯图加特举行的两个短跑项目的比赛。

sentences.en: Me: What do you mean "compete"?
sentences.cn: 我：你的“竞争”是什么意思？

sentences.en: Schools should not compete with each other or attempt to poach pupils.
sentences.cn: 学校之间不应该相互竞争，也不应该企图挖走彼此的学生。

sentences.en: Scientists now have to compete for funding, and do not share information among themselves.
sentences.cn: 科学家们现在为了资金不得不相互竞争，互相之间也不会共享信息。

sentences.en: Small English orchards can hardly compete economically with larger French ones.
sentences.cn: 英国的小型果园很难在经济上和法国的大型果园竞争。

sentences.en: The banks have long competed with American Express's charge cards and various shop cards.
sentences.cn: 这些银行长期以来一直与美国运通公司的记账卡和各种商店卡竞争。

sentences.en: The company must reduce costs to compete effectively.
sentences.cn: 公司要有效地参与竞争必须降低成本。

sentences.en: The price must be right in order to compete internationally.
sentences.cn: 为了在国际上竞争,定价必须适当.

sentences.en: The stores have to compete for customers in the Christmas season.
sentences.cn: 圣诞节期间，商店之间要争抢顾客。

sentences.en: These products are of high quality and able to compete internationally.
sentences.cn: 这些产品品质很好,在国际市场上有竞争能力.

sentences.en: They are now trying to compete on an equal footing.
sentences.cn: 他们现在想要公平竞争。

sentences.en: They believe they're playing a zero-sum game, where both must compete for the same paltry resources.
sentences.cn: 他们明白他们正处于一场零和博弈中，双方必须针锋相对，争夺那少得可怜的资源。

sentences.en: They found themselves competing with foreign companies for a share of the market.
sentences.cn: 他们发现自己在与外国公司争夺市场份额。

sentences.en: They will compete for prizes totalling nearly £3,000.
sentences.cn: 他们将为总额近3,000英镑的奖金展开争夺。

sentences.en: When I began to compete again, I was struggling with my run-up.
sentences.cn: 当我重新参赛后，我要解决助跑这一项。

words.tran_cn: 竞争的；比赛的；求胜心切的

trans.tran_en: if one company or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its goods or servicesrather than those available from another company or country

trans.tran_cn: 竞争， 比赛， 对抗
trans.tran_en: if one company or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its goods or servicesrather than those available from another company or country
